service: O'QT — OECD QSAR Toolbox AI Assistant
description: A multi-agent assistant that connects to a locally running OECD QSAR Toolbox Web API to analyze chemicals, profile hazards, and suggest read-across strategies. O’QT fetches properties, experimental data, and profiling outputs from the Toolbox and synthesizes them into an AI-generated report.
release_notes: 2025-09-05: Initial registry entry. Clarified EULA constraints; added Docker usage note (assistant only).

access.login: Requires a locally installed OECD QSAR Toolbox with Web API enabled on Windows; set QSAR_TOOLBOX_API_URL. Provide an OpenAI API key for AI analysis.

assumptions_limitations_uncertainties: Hard requirement: a locally installed OECD QSAR Toolbox on Windows with the Web API enabled; the assistant does not include the Toolbox.
EULA prohibits bundling/redistribution of the Toolbox; no Docker image can legally contain it.
Assistant quality depends on data availability/coverage in the Toolbox databases and profiles used.
AI synthesis (OpenAI) can introduce uncertainty; always review cited data and read-across rationale.
legal: OECD QSAR Toolbox EULA restricts copying, redistribution, and modification (e.g., Articles 2.2.b, 2.2.c, 2.2.f).
O’QT is Apache-2.0; the Toolbox remains separately licensed by OECD.
external_materials: Optional: additional profiles/databases configured inside the Toolbox
references: Project README for architecture and prompts

faq.q: Can I run this without the OECD QSAR Toolbox?
faq.a: No. O’QT is a client; it queries your locally running Toolbox Web API for all chemical data.

faq.q: Why no Docker image with the Toolbox included?
faq.a: The Toolbox EULA prohibits redistribution and bundling. You may containerize the assistant only.
The Toolbox requires Windows. The assistant can run on Windows/macOS/Linux (or in Docker) and point to the Windows host.
Set QSAR_TOOLBOX_API_URL to the Toolbox API endpoint (e.g., http://localhost:5000/api or http://<windows-ip>:5000/api).

related_case_study: General chemicals; adaptable per Toolbox profiles
validation_status: Under Development / Prototype; leverages OECD QSAR Toolbox (established)
